New_York.Cortlandt Street (BMT Broadway Line): Cortlandt Street is a local station on the BMT Broadway Line of the New York City Subway. Originally opened in 1918, the station is located under Church Street, between Fulton and Cortlandt Streets in the Financial District of Lower Manhattan. It is served by the R train at all times except late nights, when the N train takes over service. The W train also serves this station on weekdays. Passageways link this station to the World Trade Center PATH station, and to neighboring subway stations at Fulton Street (through an out-of-fare-control Dey Street passageway), and Chambers Street–World Trade Center/Park Place the latter allowing a free transfer to the A, C, 2 and 3 trains that is not provided by the Dey Street passage.
